_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Overview:



The Employees at Ferrellgas (FG) Waldo, Wisconsin are strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This facility is operated to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and is designed and operated in accordance with NFPA 58 Liquefied Petroleum Gas Code requirements. In addition, FG Waldo operates this facility in accordance with our internal standards that employs good engineering practice and industry accepted principles and codes. FG Waldo has instituted operating and training procedures that are designed to provide a safe work environment and protect our neighbors.



FG Waldo operates a propane facility adjacent to a rail spur. It is comprised of one RMP covered process involving propane. The primary purpose of this facility is to distribute propane to wholesale customers. All propane is delivered to the facility by railcar, pumped into bulk tanks and then pumped into trucks. No other RMP regulated substances are handled at this facility.







Emergency Response Plan:  



FG Waldo coordinates emergency response with the local Fire Department to deal with accidental releases of propane. We have coordinated our activities for emergency planning and our facility is included in the community emergency response plan.  FG Waldo does not perform emergency response as defined by EPA RMP rules. Our Employees perform incidental response, which is limited to actions that can be safely taken to stop or prevent a minor release of product. 







Prevention Program:  



Our facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirement set out under 40 CFR part 68. This facility was designed and constructed in accordance with NFPA-58 Standard. The elements of the release prevention program that are in place at our facility include Safety Information, Hazard Review, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity Program, Compliance Audits, and Incident Investigation. Employe

es have been trained on the procedures associated with the processes and the Emergency Action Plan, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local regulations.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Fire Department and any potentially affected neighbors.







5-Year Accident History:  



This is the initial filing of the FG Waldo RMP.  No accidental releases have occurred at the Site.









Planned changes to improve safety: 



We constantly review our propane operations and procedures to improve safety.  There are no current plans to change our current operation.
